div.l: Hire caple cacche he ran al wey so faste
Til in a diche thei caught him atte laste
Wery and wete as beest is in the rayn
Cometh sely Iohn and with him cometh Alayn
Allas quod Iohn the day þat I was born
Now ere we dryuen til hething and til skorn
Oure corne is stole men wole vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn ⁊and oure felawes alle
And namely the mellere weylaway
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by the way
Toward the Mille with bayard in his hond
The Millere sittyng bi the fuyre he fond
For it was nyght and furthre myght þei noght
But for þe loue of god thei him bisoght
Of herberwe and of ese as for hir peny
The Millere seide ageyn if there be eny
Suche as it is ȝit schole ȝe haue ȝoure part
My hous is streite but ȝe han lerned art
Ȝe can by argument make a place
A Mile brood of twenty foot of space
Lat se now ȝif this place mowe suffice
Or make it romer with speche as is ȝoure gise
Now Symond seide þis Iohn by seint Cutberd
Ay is thou merie ⁊and þat is faire vnswerd
I haue herd say men sall taken of twa þinges
Swilk as he fynt or take swilke as he bringes
But specially I pray the Oost dere
Get vs som mete ⁊and drinke ⁊and make vs chere
And we wol paien trewely atte fulle
With empty hondes men may none haukes tulle
Lo here oure seluer redy forto spende
This mellere to þe toıı̄un his doghter sende
For ale ⁊and breed ⁊and rosted hem a goos
And bonde hire hors it schulde namore goo loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bedde
With schetes ⁊and wiþ chaloıı̄uns faire I spredde
Noght for his owne bed ten foote nor twelue
His doughter hadde a bed all by here selue
